channel.title: Cariboo Signals
channel.copyright: © 2026 Erich Zirnhelt. Licensed under CC BY-NC 4.0.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Technology and society in rural BC with Riley and Casey
channel.itunes:author: Riley and Casey
channel.itunes:summary: How do rural communities grow alongside technology? Daily conversations about responsible tech progress in the Cariboo region on the traditional territories of the Secwépemc, Tŝilhqot'in, and Dakelh nations. Riley brings tech systems thinking with rural roots, while Casey focuses on community development. New episodes every day with weekly themes.
channel.description: How do rural communities grow alongside technology? Daily conversations about responsible tech progress in the Cariboo region on the traditional territories of the Secwépemc, Tŝilhqot'in, and Dakelh nations.

item.title: Community Tech And Governance
item.description: How do rural communities grow alongside technology? Daily conversations about responsible tech progress in the Cariboo region on the traditional territories of the Secwépemc, Tŝilhqot'in, and Dakelh nations. Today's focus: Community Tech And Governance DEEP DIVE: Can AI-driven infrastructure management systems enhance rural governance while maintaining democratic accountability and community-centered decision-making? Topics: Predictive maintenance vs. reactive infrastructure management, Regional cooperation and shared technology services, Democratic accountability and citizen understanding of AI decisions, Digital divide in rural civic engagement, Cost-benefit analysis of municipal AI adoption Sources cited in this episode: 1. My Cariboo Now: [My Cariboo Now] Independent Investigations Office determini... 2. Quesnel Cariboo Observer: [Quesnel Cariboo Observer] Former B.C. Conservative leader w... 3. item.title: Working Lands And Industry
item.description: How do rural communities grow alongside technology? Daily conversations about responsible tech progress in the Cariboo region on the traditional territories of the Secwépemc, Tŝilhqot'in, and Dakelh nations. Today's focus: Working Lands And Industry DEEP DIVE: Whether increasing technology dependence in resource industries like ranching, forestry, and mining will ultimately benefit or harm rural working communities in the Cariboo region. Topics: Battery reliability and maintenance infrastructure gaps, Competition between data centers and resource industries for electricity, Local technical capacity and repair capabilities, Economic diversification versus traditional industry stability, Technology as amplification versus replacement of human expertise Sources cited in this episode: 1. GN Clean Energy and EVs: [GN Clean Energy and EVs] MDL expands its BYD partnership wi... 2. Hackaday: [Hackaday] Performing an Autopsy on 15 Dead Battle Born LFP ... 3.
